Reviews.Title: “Fair price. Clean quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Willaim W
Reviews.Content: Been coming to this property for several years. Friendly staff. Clean quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here in the dead of winter and still keep going!”
Reviews.Author: PoshPrilla
Reviews.Content: Complete dump! Nasty, and very unclean. We only stayed one night and that was one night too many. The air conditioner couldn't keep up with the soaring temperatures. I woke up in the middle of the night soaking wet, because I had sweated so. I didn't have on heavy pajamas, just a short sleeve top and capri style bottoms. When we complained to the manager he acted like he didn't care. The hotel was cheap, but spend an extra few dollars and pay for a decent hotel, especially one where you can look out the window and see your car.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (a dump with fresh paint)”
Reviews.Author: EvetteD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very cheap but there were problems. The sink and bathroom wall was dirty. Once I pulled back the sheets, there were greasy looking stains, along with something reddish brown smeared on the sheets, along with a hole. I called the front desk and was told that they would check to see if there were clean sheets and bring them to my room. The hotel staff came to the room with the blanket. I explained the blanket was fine and showed him the sheets. He went back downstairs and returned later with two flat sheets. I took them and had to change the linen myself. YUCK!! With another "!" During the night my family and I sweated so bad we were wet. The air was turned down as low as possible and blowing as hard as it could. However it just did not work. I spoke to the manager at checkout and he was completely unconcerned. Probably had heard the complaint before and just didn't do anything about it. His attitude was "Oh really. So what...I got your money. Now get out. Too bad for you." He did nothing. So I'm doing what I can by giving him some free advertisement. Travelers spend a few more dollars and stay somewhere that will be cool and clean.

Reviews.Title: “The bed bugs bite.”
Reviews.Author: khalp
Reviews.Content: We weren't thrilled to stay at this hotel in the first place, but it was a busy weekend in Memphis and all the decent places were booked. We paid the same for our room here as we did at the much nicer Doubletree downtown, so it felt like a rip-off but we soldiered on. Overall, we felt like it was an ok place to stay, albeit out of the way, but that changed when we discovered BED BUG BITES in the morning. In the week following our stay, we contacted the hotel directly to report the problem and ask for our money back. They never returned my calls, did not seem to care that we had been bitten, and finally determined that there were no bed bugs and so no problem. They refused to reimburse us for our stay and remained unapologetic. We are taking it up with the national Days Inn company.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Zelda1234567
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed here over Labor Day and found it to be, as most of the other reviewers stated, clean, safe, and a real bargain for the money. I have stayed at hotels a lot more expensive that weren't this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TexasCarolyn
Reviews.Content: I was traveling through Memphis, and I was just looking for a place to sleep, so I did not want to spend much money. I have had bad experiences with Days Inns in the past, but I decided to go for this one because the price was lower than others. This hotel was much better than I expected. The decor was not too stylish, but the bed was very comfortable and the shower had plenty of water pressure and hot water. The air conditioner worked great. The room was clean but the finish on the sink was flaking off which made it look dirty. Also, it was very quiet. We heard someone pass by with a rolling bag once, but that was all the noise we heard. Breakfast was not fancy, but it was about as expected from most motels. The only real complaint was that the light bulbs in the lamps seemed to be around 15 watts. It was hard to read. If you are looking for a fancy place with lots of amenities, this is not your place. If you are looking for a comfortable bed, a hot shower, and peace and quiet, check this out.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but worth the money”
Reviews.Author: catchburns
Reviews.Content: I found this motel to be exactly what I expected - clean, comfortable, but with no frills. That's exactly what we got. The staff isn't extremely friendly but everything was in order and the hotel was a good deal for the money. It was reasonably quite and in a decent area of town. I would stay here again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Safe Area of town especially next to a Prison”
Reviews.Author: clarsenseattle102
Reviews.Content: We were moving to Memphis from Washington State and we got into Memphis at 10PM we got to the Days Inn and people were just walking around out of nowhere. My dad stayed at the Days Inn in Lakeland way better and nicer and Safer. If drivig on I-40 looking for a hotel go to the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Pass this one by”
Reviews.Author: stayn2busy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one night stay through Priceline.com (which by the way is the last time I will use Priceline). I had requested a smoke free room. When I arrived, not only was the hotel not in a safe part of town, there were some shady type men walking around in the parking area. I get to the "smoke free" room and it's over powering smoke smell immediately gave me a migrane. I turned in my key and told the desk clerk I could not stay there...not only for the smoke smell, but I didn't feel safe in this hotel and area. I went a couple miles down the road to the Days Inn at Canada Road and couldn't have been more pleased! It was wonderful. **Priceline will not refund your money even when they book you a less than standard room****BEWARE OF PRICELINE.COM and the Days Inn at Sycamore!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the price - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: pamyllia
Reviews.Content: I was having a lot of trouble trying to find a place to stay in Memphis (for a family trip to Graceland). Reading TripAdvisor reviews, it seemed that I'd run the risk of being knifed overnight in a room filled with cockroaches if I didn't pay over $150 per night somewhere. My mom and sister and I really didn't want to pay that much for a hotel! Nor did we want to stay in one of Memphis' apparently abundantly sketchy neighborhoods, or in a dirty hotel. This Days Inn was a great compromise. Since we had a rental car, it didn't matter how far we were from downtown. And the rates are nice and cheap! The rooms were solid. My sister went inspecting the sheets for bedbugs and stains and found nothing. My mom's room was also fine. The bathrooms were clean and adequate. The beds were comfortable. There wasn't too much noise - especially since we were on the back side of the hotel, away from the street. In the evenings, we dragged our chairs onto the balcony and enjoyed the lovely weather. It wasn't a beautiful view staring into the side of the LaQuinta next door, but the grass around the hotel is green and you can still see the sky :) Breakfast was fine - enough choices for a picky eater and even a vegan. I have three complaints that are absolutely negated by how reasonable the rates were: 1) my mom's refrigerator didn't work - she lost some tasty leftovers from a meal out that she was looking forward to finishing the next day 2) our microwave didn't work - I just used my mom's next door 3) the 'neighborhood' is a street lined with nothing but hotels, fast food chains, gas stations, and more hotels. There's really nothing to do or see in the environs - but I was aware of that going in. The Days Inn is right off route 40, and about 20 minutes to everything we wanted to do - 20 minutes from Graceland, 20 minutes from Beale Street/downtown/Sun Studios/Stax, etc. I also recommend going to Corky's in Germantown from here - it's only about 10 minutes away. All in all, this was a perfect hotel for our purposes, cheap, safe, and fully capable of delivering a good night's sleep to anyone. it's really all I could have asked for for under $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: wmmary
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and the staff were courteous. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again. Good proximity to Bass Pro shop if you're going there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in...bar none.”
Reviews.Author: 2wenty4our
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Easter Weekend, April 5-8, 2007. Booked here for what I was assured was a "two person Jacuzzi", which turned out to be a one person Jacuzzi. Hot breakfast is either microwaved or crock-pots, and limited seating. We did not receive fresh towel service (until we called and requested them) or have our beds made (though they did pick up soiled towels). About a half hour later the maid would have barged into our room if I hadn't had the door dead bolted (the door hit the end of the security bolt so hard it shook the entire room). Check out time is 11:00am, so my family and I went to eat breakfast elsewhere, and came back at 10:45 to finish packing - room was already being cleaned and our personal linens were already packed away in "storage". Other personal items (protable DVD player, camera, etc) were stacked off to the side (no one will explain to me why these were held back from storage).

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn IH 40 & Sycamore View
HotelInfo.Address: 6055 Macon Cove, I-40 E & Sycamore View, Memphis, TN 38134
